--- title: "Day 13" title-slide-attributes: data-background-image: images/lake.jpg data-background-size: contain data-background-opacity: "0.5" subtitle: "Math 216: Statistical Thinking" author: "Bastola" format: revealjs: html-math-method: mathjax mathjax-url: "https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/mathjax/3.2.2/MathJax.js" theme: [default, scss/main.scss] slide-number: true preview-links: auto history: true chalkboard: src: drawings.json transition: slide background-transition: fade touch: false controls: true --- ## Introduction to Assessing Normality {.font80} ::: cle13 \boxed{\text{Why check normality?}} - **Goal**: Verify if data comes from a normal distribution, required for many parametric tests (e.g., t-tests, ANOVA). - **Key Context**: Ensures validity of statistical inferences. - **Primary Methods**: 1. Visual checks (plots) 2. Empirical rule alignment 3. IQR/SD ratio ::: ## Visual Assessment Tools {.font80} ::: cle10 \boxed{\text{Graphical Methods}} - **Histogram/Density Plot**: - Look for symmetric bell-shaped curve. - Check tails: abrupt drops may indicate non-normality. - **Q-Q Plot**: - Data points should align with 45° reference line. - Curves or outliers = potential skew/kurtosis. ::: ## Numerical Assessment Methods {.font80} ::: cle6 \boxed{\text{Quantitative Checks}} - **Empirical Rule**: - $\pm1\sigma$: ≈68%, $\pm2\sigma$: ≈95%, $\pm3\sigma$: ≈99.7%. - Compare calculated %s to these benchmarks. - **IQR/SD Ratio**: - For normality: $\frac{\text{IQR}}{s} \approx 1.3$. - Compute via $\frac{Q3 - Q1}{s}$ and compare. ::: ## Case Study: EPA ratings {.font80}
> The dataset consists of EPA gas mileage ratings for 100 cars. Each value represents the miles per gallon (MPG) that a particular car achieves under standardized testing conditions. This dataset can help understand how statistical methods are applied in real-world scenarios like assessing the fuel efficiency of vehicles. ## {.font60} ::: panel-tabset ### Data EPA Gas Mileage Ratings for 100 Cars (miles per gallon) | col1 |col2|col3|col4|col5|col6|col7|col8|col9|col10| | :------|:------|:------|:------|:------|:------|:------|:------|:------|:------| | 36.3 | 41.0 | 36.9 | 37.1 | 44.9 | 36.8 | 30.0 | 37.2 | 42.1 | 36.7 | | 32.7 | 37.3 | 41.2 | 36.6 | 32.9 | 36.5 | 33.2 | 37.4 | 37.5 | 33.6 | | 40.5 | 36.5 | 37.6 | 33.9 | 40.2 | 36.4 | 37.7 | 37.7 | 40.0 | 34.2 | | 36.2 | 37.9 | 36.0 | 37.9 | 35.9 | 38.2 | 38.3 | 35.7 | 35.6 | 35.1 | | 38.5 | 39.0 | 35.5 | 34.8 | 38.6 | 39.4 | 35.3 | 34.4 | 38.8 | 39.7 | | 36.3 | 36.8 | 32.5 | 36.4 | 40.5 | 36.6 | 36.1 | 38.2 | 38.4 | 39.3 | | 41.0 | 31.8 | 37.3 | 33.1 | 37.0 | 37.6 | 37.0 | 38.7 | 39.0 | 35.8 | | 37.0 | 37.2 | 40.7 | 37.4 | 37.1 | 37.8 | 35.9 | 35.6 | 36.7 | 34.5 | | 37.1 | 40.3 | 36.7 | 37.0 | 33.9 | 40.1 | 38.0 | 35.2 | 34.8 | 39.5 | | 39.9 | 36.9 | 32.9 | 33.8 | 39.8 | 34.0 | 36.8 | 35.0 | 38.1 | 36.9 | ### R code ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # store 100 mpgs in an object called 'mpg' mpg <- c( 36.3, 41.0, 36.9, 37.1, 44.9, 36.8, 30.0, 37.2, 42.1, 36.7, 32.7, 37.3, 41.2, 36.6, 32.9, 36.5, 33.2, 37.4, 37.5, 33.6, 40.5, 36.5, 37.6, 33.9, 40.2, 36.4, 37.7, 37.7, 40.0, 34.2, 36.2, 37.9, 36.0, 37.9, 35.9, 38.2, 38.3, 35.7, 35.6, 35.1, 38.5, 39.0, 35.5, 34.8, 38.6, 39.4, 35.3, 34.4, 38.8, 39.7, 36.3, 36.8, 32.5, 36.4, 40.5, 36.6, 36.1, 38.2, 38.4, 39.3, 41.0, 31.8, 37.3, 33.1, 37.0, 37.6, 37.0, 38.7, 39.0, 35.8, 37.0, 37.2, 40.7, 37.4, 37.1, 37.8, 35.9, 35.6, 36.7, 34.5, 37.1, 40.3, 36.7, 37.0, 33.9, 40.1, 38.0, 35.2, 34.8, 39.5, 39.9, 36.9, 32.9, 33.8, 39.8, 34.0, 36.8, 35.0, 38.1, 36.9 ) mpg_data <- data.frame(mpg = mpg) ``` ::: ::: ## Visualization Approach {.font70} ::: panel-tabset ### Step 1: Histogram + Density ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Day13_files/figure-revealjs/enhanced-hist-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ### Step 2: Boxplot Analysis ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Day13_files/figure-revealjs/boxplot-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ::: ## Normality Assessment {.font70} ::: panel-tabset ### Q-Q Plot Diagnostics ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Day13_files/figure-revealjs/qq-enhanced-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ### Empirical Rule Check ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Day13_files/figure-revealjs/empirical-rule-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ### IQR/SD Ratio Test ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} | IQR| SD| Ratio| Expected| Difference| |----:|----:|-----:|--------:|----------:| | 2.65| 2.42| 1.1| 1.3| -0.2| ::: ::: ::: ## Key Findings from EPA Case Study {.font70} ::: cle13 1. Visual Evidence: - Histogram shows right skew (confirmed by boxplot outlier at 44.9 MPG) - Q-Q plot shows systematic deviation from reference line in upper tail 2. Empirical Rule Compliance: - 72% within μ±1σ (expected 68%) - **Close** - 95% within μ±2σ (exact match) - **Good** - 100% within μ±3σ (expected 99.7%) - **Borderline** 3. IQR/SD Ratio: - Observed 1.1 vs Expected 1.3 - **Suggests lighter tails** ::: ## Implications for Future Analysis {.font70} ::: {.cell} ::: ::: panel-tabset ### Original Data ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Day13_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ### Square Root Transformed ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Day13_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ### Log Transformed ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Day13_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: :::

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
